list.title: Beyond Lean and Agile
list.summary: In large part that’s the nature of the beast.  People are always searching for a silver bullet, and there is always a willing industry, ready and waiting to serve with books, coaching, training, and consulting.  But of course there is no silver bullet, and inevitably people figure this out, and then the backlash comes.  As I write this, it’s in vogue to criticize both Lean and Agile.

list.title: The Right Way to Do Lean Research
list.summary: Laura Klein expounds on these key themes of lean research.

list.title: The GV research sprint: a 4-day process for answering important startup questions
list.summary: The founders and designers we work with in the Google Ventures portfolio have a lot of important questions. Is there a market for my product? Will my product help people solve their problems? What should I build? The answers to these questions just raise more questions: Do people understand my product? Will people find my product useful? Can people use my product? And so it continues. As we build our businesses, each answer reveals new unknowns.

list.title: Lean UX - Applying Lean Principles to Improve User Experience
list.summary: The Lean UX approach to interaction design is tailor-made for today’s web-driven reality. In this insightful book, leading advocate Jeff Gothelf teaches you valuable Lean UX principles, tactics, and techniques from the ground up—how to rapidly experiment with design ideas, validate them with real users, and continually adjust your design based on what you learn.

list.title: UX for Lean Startups - Faster, Smarter User Experience Research and Design
list.summary: Great user experiences (UX) are essential for products today, but designing one can be a lengthy and expensive process. With this practical, hands-on book, you’ll learn how to do it faster and smarter using Lean UX techniques.

list.title: Sprint: How To Solve Big Problems and Test New Ideas in Just Five Days
list.summary: A practical guide to answering critical business questions, Sprint is a book for teams of any size, from small startups to Fortune 100s, from teachers to nonprofits. It’s for anyone with a big opportunity, problem, or idea who needs to get answers today.
list.person: Jake Knapp with John Zeratsky and Braden Kowitz
